data.title: Jazz on the Patio — The Barn at Paradise Station
data.meta_description: A weekly treat of jazz, drinks and small plates fare on the patio. Every Thursday from Memorial Day through Labor Day. This week: The Andy Roberts Quartet
data.text:
The Barn at Paradise Station welcomes The Andy Roberts Quartet. Join Mount Gretna pianist Andy Roberts with vibraphonist Tony Miceli from Philadelphia, Lancaster’s own John Gingerich on bass and drummer Pete Lazorcik from New York City. Enjoy this amazing jazz group while dining on the patio overlooking the Strasburg Rail Road and gorgeous countryside.

Served small plates fare as well as wine and beer available for purchase.

Doors open at 6 p.m. Music beginning at 6:30 p.m.

Reservations accepted but not required.

Casual dress.

No cover.

Free parking.

In the event of inclement weather, Jazz on the Patio will be held inside the lower level of the Barn.

ABOUT ANDY ROBERTS

Andy Roberts has been active in the Central PA music scene for many years. By age 15, he was gigging with rock and country bands at local clubs. Upon discovering Oscar Peterson and Dave Brubeck, he became further inspired by the challenges of jazz, and after receiving the Joe Zawinul scholarship, enrolled in Berklee College of Music, Boston Massachusetts, graduating in 1989.

Currently, Roberts maintains a busy schedule of performing, writing and music directing. As a freelance jazz pianist, he has had the opportunity to perform with many great musicians from the tri-state area. Also known for his keyboard work, Andy is a seasoned rock and blues keyboardist as well.

​In theater, Roberts has 30+ years experience writing original musical revues. Since 2009 he has been music director/pianist for The American Music Theatre in Lancaster, PA. There he arranges, plays piano and conducts the vocalists and band in their original productions.
